gbuild.button

Class GButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • gbuild.GComponent
      • gbuild.button.GButton
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GButtonClose, GButtonEmpty, GButtonWithText

    public abstract class GButton
extends GComponent

    Component for buttons

    Processing language environment includes utilities to manage mouse or key events. Taking this into account, this class was designed to be a clickable component that would execute an action if user has clicked it.

    It is important to know that gBuild provides features to implement the actions that will be executed if user has clicked the button, but developers must define such actions at the Processing sketch.

    • Method Detail

      • updateButton

        public abstract void updateButton()
        Check if button is selected and update its style for hovering effect

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected()
        Return if button is selected

        This property was defined in order to offer to developers a way to manage events associated to the button.

        The following code is an example of use on which you can incorporate an event for a button 

         import gbuild.button.*;
 
 GButton button;
 
 void setup() {
  size(800, 800, P2D);
  button = new GButtonWithText(this, width / 2, height / 2);
 }
 
 void draw() {
  button.draw();
 
  if (button.isSelected()) {
      println("user has selected the button");
  }
 }
        Returns:
        selected state

      • isHover

        public boolean isHover()
        Return if button is hover

        This property was defined in order to offer to developers a way to manage events associated to the button.

        The following code is an example of use on which you can incorporate an event for a button 

         import gbuild.button.*;
 
 GButton button;
 
 void setup() {
  size(800, 800, P2D);
  button = new GButtonWithText(this, width / 2, height / 2);
 }
 
 void draw() {
  button.draw();
 
  if (button.isHover()) {
      println("user has hover the button");
  }
 }
        Returns:
        hover state

      • pos

        @Deprecated
public void pos(java.lang.Integer... coords)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: GComponent
        Specify the location for component

        It is possible to define the location in three different ways:

        1. pos(x, y) when (x, y) will be set
        2. pos(x) when x will be set
        3. pos(null, y) when y will be set
        Overrides:
        pos in class GComponent
        Parameters:
        coords - integer coordinates (x, y)

public void dim(java.lang.Integer... dim)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: GComponent
        Specify the dimension for component.

        It is possible to define the dimension in three different ways:

        1. dim(w, h) when (w, h) will be set
        2. dim(w) when w will be set
        3. dim(null, h) when h will be set
        Overrides:
        dim in class GComponent
        Parameters:
        dim - integer dimensions (w, h)

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        Specify size for current button

        Since the shape of the button would be considered as a square, the dimension (w, h) would be equal

        Parameters:
        size - button size
